message_1:
Simplify the following trigonometric expression: 

sin²(x) + 2sin(x)cos(x) + cos²(x) 

Hint: Use the identity sin²(x) + cos²(x) = 1.
message_2:
We can rewrite the given expression as:

sin²(x) + cos²(x) + 2sin(x)cos(x)

Now, using the identity sin²(x) + cos²(x) = 1, we can simplify the expression:

1 + 2sin(x)cos(x)

This is the simplified form of the given trigonometric expression.
